criteria.description: Reward function properly executes the expression and checks to see if the expression equals 24.
criteria.justification: Expression is safely evaluated via AST in evaluate_expression; rollout uses the computed value and reward_from_value yields 1.0 when value == 24, effectively checking equality.

criteria.description: Reward function makes sure that the expression uses all four digits exactly once.
criteria.justification: validate_solution enforces sorted(numbers_used) == sorted(puzzle), ensuring each provided digit is used exactly once and no extras.

criteria.description: Environment and prompting is setup to elicit thinking / reasoning in a <thinking> tag or equivalent.
criteria.justification: Prompt constrains output to <solution> XML only and does not request or capture a <thinking> tag or equivalent structured reasoning.

criteria.description: Reward function is smooth with positive reward for being close to 24.
criteria.justification: reward_from_value uses exp(-|24 - value|/24) for valid solutions, giving a smooth, positive shaping signal approaching 1 as value approaches 24.

criteria.description: Penalty or reward for following the demanded formatting.
criteria.justification: Invalid XML is penalized (valid=False -> reward -1). Although a wrong root tag currently raises an uncaught ValueError in rollout, formatting noncompliance is intended to be penalized.

notes: Strong safe evaluation, digit-usage enforcement, and smooth shaping. Missing any thinking/<thinking> prompting, so no points there. Note: rollout raises an uncaught ValueError when the root XML tag is not <solution>; consider catching ValueError alongside ET.ParseError and assigning a formatting error with negative reward.
